Comments_List: The course provides an excellent overview of feminist legal theory and philosophy. The first half of the course covers a wide array of different schools of thought, and the second half is more about case studies of individual issues (reproductive rights, sex work, family, etc).
I learned how to engage with legal theory and how to craft philosophically rigorous arguments. I learned the wide array of ways in which feminist theory can be applied to many topics in society.

Definitely recommend if you are involved in feminist-oriented activism and want to learn more about the different theories undergirding this kind of work! Also good for people considering law as a career as many of the writings engage the possibilities of law for creating feminist change.
I would recommend it if the student was interested in philosophy or feminist theory or law on any capacity.
